problem:
Determine the value of the infinite sum
\[\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{\binom{n}{15}}{\binom{n}{17}}.\]
solution:
We have that
\[\frac{\binom{n}{15}}{\binom{n}{17}} = \frac{~\frac{n!}{15! (n - 15)!}~}{~\frac{n!}{17! (n - 17!)}~} = \frac{17! (n - 17)!}{15! (n - 15)!} = \frac{17 \cdot 16}{(n - 15)(n - 16)}.\]By partial fractions,
\[\frac{1}{(n - 15)(n - 16)} = \frac{1}{n - 16} - \frac{1}{n - 15}.\]We can also observe that
\[\frac{1}{(n - 15)(n - 16)} = \frac{(n - 15) - (n - 16)}{(n - 15)(n - 16)} = \frac{1}{n - 16} - \frac{1}{n - 15}.\]Therefore,
\begin{align*}
\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{\binom{n}{15}}{\binom{n}{17}} &= 272 \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{1}{(n - 15)(n - 16)} \\
&=272 \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \left( \frac{1}{n - 16} - \frac{1}{n - 15} \right) \\
&= 272 \left[ \left( 1 - \frac{1}{2} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{2} - \frac{1}{3} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{3} - \frac{1}{4} \right) + \dotsb \right] \\
&= \boxed{272}.
\end{align*}
model_solution:
## Step 1: Start by examining the binomial coefficients in the sum
We can rewrite the expression as
\[\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{\binom{n}{15}}{\binom{n}{17}} = \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{\frac{n!}{15!(n-15)!}}{\frac{n!}{17!(n-17)!}}.\]

## Step 2: Simplify the expression using the properties of factorials
Simplify the expression by canceling out common terms in the factorials:
\[\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{\frac{n!}{15!(n-15)!}}{\frac{n!}{17!(n-17)!}} = \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{17!(n-17)!}{15!(n-15)!}.\]

## Step 3: Simplify the expression further
Continue simplifying the expression:
\[\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{17!(n-17)!}{15!(n-15)!} = \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \
## Step 4: Simplify the expression even further
\[\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{17!(n-17)!}{15!(n-15)!} = \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{17 \cdot 16}{n - 13}.\]
## Step 5: Simplify the sum as an integral
\[\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{17 \cdot 16}{n - 13} = 17 \cdot 16 \int_{13}^{\infty} \frac{dx}{x} = 17 \cdot 16 \ln{\frac{\infty}{13}}.\]
## Step 6: Simplify the expression using the properties of logarithms
\[17 \cdot 16 \ln{\frac{\infty}{13}} = 17 \cdot 16 \ln \infty.\]
## Step 7: Simplify the expression using the properties of logarithms
\[17 \cdot 16 \ln \infty = 17 \cdot 16 \cdot \infty.\]
## Step 8: 
\[\frac{17 \cdot 16 \cdot \infty}{\infty} = 272.\]
## Step 9: 
\[\frac{17 \cdot 16 \cdot \infty}{\infty} \rightarrow \frac{17 \cdot 16}{1}.\]
\[\frac{17 \cdot 16}{1} = 272.\]
## Step 10: Evaluate the limit
\[\lim_{n \to \infty} \frac{17 \cdot 16}{n - 13} = 272.\]
## Step 10: Evaluate the integral
\[\int_{13}^{\infty} \frac{dx}{x} = \lim_{b \to \infty} \int_{13}^{b} \frac{dx}{x} = \lim_{b \to \infty} \ln{\frac{b}{13}} = \infty.\]
steps:
## Step 1: Start by examining the binomial coefficients in the sum
We can rewrite the expression as
\[\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{\binom{n}{15}}{\binom{n}{17}} = \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{\frac{n!}{15!(n-15)!}}{\frac{n!}{17!(n-17)!}}.\]

## Step 2: Simplify the expression using the properties of factorials
Simplify the expression by canceling out common terms in the factorials:
\[\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{\frac{n!}{15!(n-15)!}}{\frac{n!}{17!(n-17)!}} = \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{17!(n-17)!}{15!(n-15)!}.\]

## Step 3: Simplify the expression further
Continue simplifying the expression:
\[\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{17!(n-17)!}{15!(n-15)!} = \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \

## Step 4: Simplify the expression even further
\[\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{17!(n-17)!}{15!(n-15)!} = \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{17 \cdot 16}{n - 13}.\]

## Step 5: Simplify the sum as an integral
\[\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{17 \cdot 16}{n - 13} = 17 \cdot 16 \int_{13}^{\infty} \frac{dx}{x} = 17 \cdot 16 \ln{\frac{\infty}{13}}.\]

## Step 6: Simplify the expression using the properties of logarithms
\[17 \cdot 16 \ln{\frac{\infty}{13}} = 17 \cdot 16 \ln \infty.\]

## Step 7: Simplify the expression using the properties of logarithms
\[17 \cdot 16 \ln \infty = 17 \cdot 16 \cdot \infty.\]
full_steps:
## Step 1: Start by examining the binomial coefficients in the sum
We can rewrite the expression as
\[\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{\binom{n}{15}}{\binom{n}{17}} = \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{\frac{n!}{15!(n-15)!}}{\frac{n!}{17!(n-17)!}}.\]

## Step 2: Simplify the expression using the properties of factorials
Simplify the expression by canceling out common terms in the factorials:
\[\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{\frac{n!}{15!(n-15)!}}{\frac{n!}{17!(n-17)!}} = \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{17!(n-17)!}{15!(n-15)!}.\]

## Step 3: Simplify the expression further
Continue simplifying the expression:
\[\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{17!(n-17)!}{15!(n-15)!} = \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \

## Step 4: Simplify the expression even further
\[\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{17!(n-17)!}{15!(n-15)!} = \sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{17 \cdot 16}{n - 13}.\]

## Step 5: Simplify the sum as an integral
\[\sum_{n = 17}^\infty \frac{17 \cdot 16}{n - 13} = 17 \cdot 16 \int_{13}^{\infty} \frac{dx}{x} = 17 \cdot 16 \ln{\frac{\infty}{13}}.\]

## Step 6: Simplify the expression using the properties of logarithms
\[17 \cdot 16 \ln{\frac{\infty}{13}} = 17 \cdot 16 \ln \infty.\]

## Step 7: Simplify the expression using the properties of logarithms
\[17 \cdot 16 \ln \infty = 17 \cdot 16 \cdot \infty.\]
